text: Lucy Ozarin (August 8, 1914 - September 17, 2017) was an American psychiatrist. She was born in Brooklyn, New York. She served in the United States Navy. She was one of the first women psychiatrists commissioned in the Navy, and she was one of seven women Navy psychiatrists who served during World War II."A Remarkable Career in Psychiatry". Circulating Now. United States National Library of Medicine. August 18, 2014. During her late nineties, Ozarin wrote over fifty brief biographies of psychiatrists on Wikipedia.Conuel, Thomas. "Dr. Lucy Ozarin, NLM Volunteer Extraordinaire!". NLM in Focus. August 24, 2012. Ozarin died in Bethesda, Maryland on September 17, 2017 of respiratory failure at the age of 103. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Disease-related deaths in Maryland Category:American psychiatrists Category:American centenarians Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Writers from New York City Category:Military people from New York (state)
title: Lucy Ozarin
